[Could dispense with 2 men if he had additional boys from Ind Schools recommends that if the men be discharged they should be employed in some other dept]
For background and previous discussion of using boys from the industrial school after M's budget for wages had been reduced,seeM to W. Odgers, 26 August 1870 and notes thereto, W. Odgers to M, 29 September 1870 (in this edition as 70-09-29b),and M to J. McCulloch, 30 September 1870 (in this edition as 70-09-30c).
This letter was referred back to M on5 October 1870, minuted:'discharge according to seniority'. It was returned to the ChiefSecretary's Office on14 October, then forwarded again to M on 19 October minuted'C. S. will arrange for transfer of 50 boys on Mondaynext'.Mto J. McCulloch, 12 October 1870,pointed out the difficulty of complying with dismissal by seniority.
